subject: Science
title: Darwin's Finches Today
description: A 60-second lesson on Darwin's Finches Today.

hook.text: Scientists have watched Darwin's finches evolve in real time â€” beak size shifting year by year.

buildup.text: Peter and Rosemary Grant studied finches on Daphne Major island for over 40 years.

discovery.text: During droughts, only large-beaked finches could crack tough seeds. Average beak size grew.

twist.text: When rains returned and soft seeds were plentiful, small beaks had the advantage again.

climax.text: They even documented a new species forming â€” a hybrid lineage that stopped interbreeding with others.

punchline.text: Evolution didn't stop long ago. It's happening on a tiny island right now.

quiz.question: What did the Grants observe about finch beaks during droughts?
options: Average beak size increased to crack harder seeds
Beaks got smaller to save energy
